ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I will recommend this course to a fellow students, especially to those who have taken course work on threats in a traditional "power" perspective.
I would highly recommend it. You learn a great deal and Christian makes sure you get what you need from the course.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: For me, it helped me appreciate non-military or non-force based threat contexts and introduced me to the concept of "risk society". the instructor has great expertise in other areas ( to inlcude in the traditional military history/political science views of politics), so I would again take a course from him as well as recommend to others to take his courses.
It introduced me to environmental security threats--
